intro: Ribes spaethianum, commonly known as the Späth gooseberry, is a deciduous shrub native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It belongs to the genus Ribes, which includes various species of flowering plants and berries. The plant produces small, yellow to orange berries that are typically harvested in late summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have serrated edges, contributing to its ornamental value. Ribes spaethianum thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in riparian zones and forest understories.
